intro: Urandra evenia, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange blooms. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Urandra evenia is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity in its native habitat.
